701979f-a.title: Bronx: Van Cortlandt Park.
701979f-a.text:
Van Cortlandt Park (Bronx): The Van Cortlandt saw and grist mill at the lower end of Van Cortlandt Lake. The mill burned down in 1901 after having been
struck by lightning.
1899
Gift of Randall Comfort

701985f-a.title: Bronx: Van Cortlandt Park.
701985f-a.text:
Van Cortlandt Park (Bronx) The Van Cortlandt House Museum, the former residence of the Van Cortlandts, built in 1748 and now maintained by the Colonial Dames. The estate was purchased by the City of New York to be
used as a park in 1889.
1981
Gift of Randall Comfort
(2)
Another view of the Van Cortlandt House.
About, 1900

701985f-b.title: Bronx: Van Cortlandt Park.
701985f-b.text:
Van Cortlandt Park (Bronx) The Van Cortlandt House Museum, the former residence of the Van Cortlandts, built in 1748 and now maintained by the Colonial Dames. The estate was purchased by the City of New York to be
used as a park in 1889.

(2)
Another view of the Van Cortlandt House.

701977f-a.title: Bronx: Van Cortlandt Park - cairn of stones on Indian Field.
701977f-a.text:
Van Cortlandt Park: A view of the cairn of stones on Indian Field. The cairn is situated on the west side of Van Cortlandt Park East, at the head of West 237th Street and is dedicated to the Stockbridge Indians.
The inscription of the tablet reads:
Augmst 31, 1778.
Upon this field
Chief Nimham
And seventeen Stockbridge Indians
As Allies of the Patriots,
Gave their lives for Liberty.
Erected by Bronx Chapter,
Daumhters of the American Revolution
Mount Vernon, N.Y.
June 14, 1906.
Gift of Randall Comfort.
1906.
701977f-a.folder: Van Cortlandt Park & cairn of stones on Indian Field., Bronx, NY

701983f-a.title: Bronx: Van Cortlandt Park - Van Cortlandt Mansion.
701983f-a.text:
VAN C.RuuuiNDI RNSI0N Van Cortlandt Tark, Sronx. Dult in 1784 by Prederick Van Cortlandt, this beorgian mansion was visited by General ashington during the Eevolutionary ar. Ihe anple stone house has an unpretentious exterior that contrasts strongly with the rich 6eorgian interor. The estate was held continuously by the Van Cortlandt family until 1858, when it was purchased by the city for
a park.
Bank ofNew York Calendar 1957-68

701980f-a.title: Bronx: Van Cortlandt Park - Van Cortlandt Mill.
701980f-a.text:
Van Cortlandt Park (Bronx): The Van Cortlandt saw and grist mill at ths southernmost tip of Van Cortlandt Lake. The mill burneo down in 1901 after having been struck by
lightning.
.About 1900
0ift of Urbrock Collection

701981f-a.title: Bronx: Van Cortlandt Park - Van Cortlandt Vault.
701981f-a.folder: Van Cortlandt Park & Van Cortlandt Vault., Bronx, NY

701982f.title: Bronx: Van Cortlandt Park - Van Cortlandt Vault.
701982f.text:
Van Cortlandt Park (Bronx): Shown is the Van Cortlandt vault, for generations the burial place of the Van Cortlandts, on the heights known as Vault Hill, to the northeast of the Van Cortlandt Mansion.
About 1891
Gift of Urbrock Collection
701982f.folder: Van Cortlandt Park & Van Cortlandt Vault., Bronx, NY

701965f-b.title: Bronx: Van Cortlandt Park.
701965f-b.text:
Van Cortlandt Park (Bronx): Northwestward across the lower end of the park and Van Cortland Lake. View 2 is directly west toward the 242nd Street station of the
T.R.T. subway on Broadway.
May 6, 1928
Views 1, 2
P. L. Sperr

701966f-a.title: Bronx: Van Cortlandt Park.
701966f-a.text:
Van Cortlandt Park (Bronx): Viewing west across the lower end of Van Cortland Lake as it is being filled. On the left is the 242nd Street I.R.T. subway station, on Broadway; on the right is the Horace Mann High School,
on West 216th Street.
About 1917

701978f-a.title: Bronx: Van Cortlandt Park.
701978f-a.text:
Van Cortlandt Park (Bronx): The remains of the Van Cortlandt graveyard, burial ground of the early New York families.
Gift of Nott Haven Library  about 1900
